title: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot in talks over mega-motor-merger
text:
Fiat Chrysler Automobiles and Peugeot-Vauxhall-owner PSA Group are in talks about a merger to create a $50bn (£39bn) automotive powerhouse.

The deal would create Europe’s second-biggest car company after VW group, with talks about a potential combination first reported by the Wall Street Journal.

Italian-American Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) - whose stable includes Alfa Romeo, Dodge, Jeep and Maserati - abandoned discussions about joining with France’s Renault in the summer amid accusations of meddling by the Paris government about how the combined business would be structured.
